## Infrastructure Project Types

::: {style="margin: 48px 0;"}
### Understanding Civil Engineering Project Complexity

::: {style="display: grid; grid-template-columns: repeat(auto-fit, minmax(300px, 1fr)); gap: 24px; margin: 32px 0;"}

::: {style="padding: 24px; background: var(--bim-light-gray); border-left: 4px solid var(--bim-orange); border-radius: 4px;"}
#### Local Roads & Access
**Length:** 500m - 2km  
**Type:** Single carriageway  
**Complexity:** Medium  
**Timeline:** 7-8 days  
**Typical Cost:** £800-1,500 per linear meter

**Characteristics:**
- Estate roads & access ways
- Standard construction depths
- Basic drainage systems
- Street lighting & furniture
- Limited earthworks
- Standard utilities diversions
:::

::: {style="padding: 24px; background: var(--bim-light-gray); border-left: 4px solid var(--bim-orange); border-radius: 4px;"}
#### Major Roads & Junctions
**Length:** 2-10km  
**Type:** Dual carriageway/major junctions  
**Complexity:** High  
**Timeline:** 9-11 days  
**Typical Cost:** £1,500-3,500 per linear meter

**Characteristics:**
- Dual carriageway sections
- Complex junction works
- Significant earthworks
- Major drainage networks
- Bridges/structures (up to 50m span)
- Extensive utilities coordination
- Traffic management complexity
:::

::: {style="padding: 24px; background: var(--bim-light-gray); border-left: 4px solid var(--bim-orange); border-radius: 4px;"}
#### Major Infrastructure
**Length:** 10km+ or complex structures  
**Type:** Highways/major bridges  
**Complexity:** Very High  
**Timeline:** 11-12 days  
**Typical Cost:** £3,000-8,000+ per linear meter

**Characteristics:**
- Motorway/highway construction
- Major bridge structures (50m+ span)
- Tunnels & underpasses
- Complex geotechnical works
- Environmental mitigations
- Major utility diversions
- Extensive traffic management
- Multi-phase delivery
:::

:::
:::

## Key Cost Drivers in Infrastructure Projects

::: {style="margin: 48px 0; padding: 32px; background: var(--bim-light-gray); border-radius: 8px;"}
### Typical Major Road Project Breakdown (per linear meter)

::: {style="display: grid; grid-template-columns: 1fr 1fr; gap: 32px; margin: 24px 0;"}

::: {style=""}
#### Earthworks & Subgrade (25-30%)
- Bulk excavation & fill: £180-320/m
- Formation treatment: £80-140/m
- Subgrade preparation: £60-100/m
- Haulage & disposal: £100-180/m
- Ground improvement: £80-160/m
- **Subtotal:** £500-900/m
:::

::: {style=""}
#### Pavement Construction (20-25%)
- Sub-base layers: £120-200/m
- Base course: £140-220/m
- Binder & surface course: £180-280/m
- Kerbs & edging: £80-140/m
- **Subtotal:** £520-840/m
:::

::: {style=""}
#### Drainage & Utilities (20-25%)
- Storm water drainage: £180-320/m
- Foul water systems: £120-220/m
- Utility diversions: £140-280/m
- Attenuation structures: £100-200/m
- **Subtotal:** £540-1,020/m
:::

::: {style=""}
#### Structures & Furniture (15-20%)
- Bridge structures (allowance): £200-400/m
- Retaining walls: £120-240/m
- Street lighting: £80-140/m
- Signs & road markings: £40-80/m
- Safety barriers: £60-120/m
- **Subtotal:** £500-980/m
:::

::: {style=""}
#### Traffic Management (10-15%)
- Temporary traffic management: £120-240/m
- Public safety measures: £60-120/m
- Diversion routes: £80-160/m
- Night/weekend premiums: £100-200/m
- **Subtotal:** £360-720/m
:::

::: {style=""}
#### Other Elements (10-15%)
- Landscaping & environment: £80-160/m
- Site clearance: £60-120/m
- Environmental mitigations: £100-200/m
- Preliminaries (12-15%): £280-520/m
- Contingency (8-12%): £200-420/m
- **Subtotal:** £720-1,420/m
:::

:::

## Our Infrastructure Estimation Process

::: {.process-steps}
::: {.process-step}
#### Initial Review & Site Analysis

**Days 1-2 (8-10 hours)**

**What We Do:**
- Review civil engineering designs
- Analyze geotechnical reports
- Assess site constraints
- Review utility surveys
- Identify environmental constraints

**Client Provides:**
- Civil engineering drawings/BIM
- Geotechnical investigation reports
- Utility survey data
- Environmental impact assessments
- Traffic management requirements

**Output:** Project plan with risk register
:::

::: {.process-step}
#### Earthworks & Ground Analysis

**Days 2-5**

**What We Do:**
- Calculate earthworks volumes
- Analyze cut/fill balance
- Assess haulage requirements
- Evaluate ground improvement needs
- Model mass haul optimization

**Technology:**
- BIM 5D volume extraction
- Cut/fill optimization software
- Haulage route modeling
- Ground treatment analysis

**Output:** Earthworks quantity take-off with optimization
:::

::: {.process-step}
#### Linear Infrastructure Quantification

**Days 3-7**

**What We Do:**
- Quantify road pavement layers
- Measure drainage networks
- Calculate structure requirements
- Count street furniture elements
- Assess utility diversions

**Coverage:**
- Carriageways & hard standings
- Footways & cycleways
- Drainage systems
- Landscaping & environmental works
- Traffic management zones

**Output:** Complete linear infrastructure BOQ
:::

::: {.process-step}
#### Structures & Utilities Analysis

**Days 5-8**

**What We Do:**
- Cost bridge structures
- Calculate retaining walls
- Quantify utility diversions
- Assess environmental mitigations
- Measure traffic management scope

**Integration:**
- Multi-discipline coordination
- Utility clash resolution
- Environmental compliance
- Traffic phasing optimization

**Output:** Structures & utilities cost breakdown
:::

::: {.process-step}
#### Cost Application & Risk Modeling

**Days 8-10**

**What We Do:**
- Apply civil engineering rates
- Factor in ground risk allowances
- Calculate traffic management costs
- Include environmental measures
- Model alternative scenarios
- Add risk contingency (10-15%)

**Database Sources:**
- Civil engineering benchmarks (UK/AU)
- Highway construction rates
- Specialist subcontractor quotes
- Recent infrastructure projects

**Output:** Detailed cost estimate with risk analysis
:::

::: {.process-step}
#### Quality Review & Presentation

**Days 10-12**

**What We Do:**
- Civil engineering peer review
- Geotechnical risk assessment
- Utility coordination verification
- Benchmark comparison
- Risk workshop (optional)

**Deliverables:**
- Executive summary (4-6 pages)
- Cost breakdown by element
- Earthworks mass haul diagram
- Risk register with allowances
- Alternative scenarios
- Phasing cost analysis

**Format:** PDF + Excel workbooks

**Support:** 90 days post-delivery included
:::
:::

::: {style="text-align: center; margin: 32px 0; padding: 24px; background: var(--bim-light-gray); border-radius: 8px;"}
**Typical Total Duration:** 9-12 working days from design receipt to final report  
**Express Service:** Limited availability for urgent projects (7-8 days) at 30% premium
:::

## Frequently Asked Questions

::: {.faq-section}
::: {.faq-item}
::: {.faq-question}
**Q: Why do infrastructure projects have higher uncertainty than buildings?**
:::
::: {.faq-answer}
A: Infrastructure projects face inherent uncertainty from ground conditions (revealed only during construction), utility clashes (survey limitations), linear project variability (changing conditions over distance), and environmental constraints (protected species, contamination). We address this through ±5-8% accuracy ranges and explicit risk allowances for these factors.
:::
:::

::: {.faq-item}
::: {.faq-question}
**Q: Can you optimize earthworks for cut/fill balance?**
:::
::: {.faq-answer}
A: Yes, we use mass haul analysis to optimize cut/fill balance, minimizing import/export costs and environmental impact. Our BIM workflows calculate earthworks volumes along the entire route and model different vertical alignment scenarios to find the optimal balance. We can save projects 10-20% on earthworks costs through optimization.
:::
:::

::: {.faq-item}
::: {.faq-question}
**Q: How do you handle utility diversion costs?**
:::
::: {.faq-answer}
A: We systematically assess utility diversions based on survey data, identifying clashes and protection requirements. Our estimates include diversion works, protective measures, temporary diversions, and utility company charges. We factor in risk allowances for unexpected utilities as surveys are rarely 100% comprehensive.
:::
:::

::: {.faq-item}
::: {.faq-question}
**Q: Can you cost bridge structures and major civil works?**
:::
::: {.faq-answer}
A: Absolutely. We have extensive experience costing bridge structures (RC and steel), retaining walls, culverts, and underpasses. For complex structures over 50m span, we work with specialist structural engineers to ensure accuracy. Our estimates include foundations, substructures, superstructures, parapets, and finishes.
:::
:::

::: {.faq-item}
::: {.faq-question}
**Q: How do you account for ground condition risks?**
:::
::: {.faq-answer}
A: We review geotechnical reports to understand ground risks and include appropriate contingencies (typically 10-15% for ground-related risks). We separately identify rock excavation allowances, contamination treatment, ground improvement, and dewatering requirements based on site investigation findings. We can model different ground scenarios if uncertainty is high.
:::
:::

::: {.faq-item}
::: {.faq-question}
**Q: Can you model phased construction to maintain traffic flow?**
:::
::: {.faq-answer}
A: Yes, we regularly prepare phased delivery estimates that maintain operational access. We model traffic management costs, night/weekend working premiums, diversion routes, and the productivity impact of working in constrained conditions. This is critical for highway improvement projects and works in urban areas.
:::
:::

::: {.faq-item}
::: {.faq-question}
**Q: How quickly can you assess alternative route alignments?**
:::
::: {.faq-answer}
A: For route optioneering, we can typically compare 2-3 alignment alternatives within 5-7 days. Our BIM workflows allow rapid calculation of earthworks volumes, pavement quantities, and structure requirements for each option. This is valuable during early design stages when route selection is still being finalized.
:::
:::

::: {.faq-item}
::: {.faq-question}
**Q: What's your fee structure for infrastructure projects?**
:::
::: {.faq-answer}
A: Fees vary based on project type, length/scale, and complexity. As a guide:
- Local roads (500m-2km): £12,000-20,000
- Major roads (2-10km): £25,000-45,000
- Major infrastructure (10km+ or complex): £45,000-80,000+
- Bridge structures: £8,000-25,000 per structure (depending on span/complexity)

Express service carries a 30% premium where available. Contact us for a specific quote.
:::
:::
:::
